description.narrative: The project will build on this earlier effort to catalyze the transformation of the sugarcane industry in Brazil into one for which supply to te grid of renewable electricity from sugarcanebiomass becomes a significant and core aspect of their business.

description.narrative: Institutional legal regulatory framework is in place to promote the sustainable use of biomass for electricity generation and sales to the grid
Mutually beneficial regulations fostering increased electricity generation with sugarcane trash are implemented

comment.narrative: Current legislation favorable to IPP generation but does not consider technicalities of generation with bagasse

Full knowledge of relevant legislation regulating the electricity sector in Brazil is obtained including potential solutions to address remaining barriers for generation with trash
Meetings conducted with relevant state entities to discuss new regulatory framework that addresses sugarcane industry trashtoelectricity issues and barriers
Mutually beneficial regulatory reforms agreed between regulating entities and the sugar sector

A meeting with UNICA has already been conducted confirming that the entity will continue to support the Project and that the need to address these regulatory aspects is a must UNICA also confirmed that a Cogeneration Group with UNICAs participation and representatives of several mills meets at regular period to discuss these barriers and is an important forum for debates and to organize contacts with Government

A meeting with UNICA has already been conducted confirming that the entity will continue to support the Project and that the need to address these regulatory aspects is a must UNICA also confirmed that a Cogeneration Group with UNICAs participation and representatives of several mills meets at regular period to discuss these barriers and is an important forum for debates and to organize contacts with Government

description.narrative: Trash system implemented and operating

comment.narrative: No mills or distilleries are using the trash produced by the green harvesting

Trash system successfully demonstrated in one mill by end of year 3
Trash system successfully operating in 3 mills by end of project

The project has not initiated its activities with GEF resources yet However during the assessment of the situation it has been verified that the work on the first mill with cofinancing from MCTI has been satisfactorily undertaken at Alta Mogiana Mill A visit was made in order to formalize a cooperation agreement between CTBE and the mill through the project duration Besides in order to update the trash system baseline it was started an evaluation of the state of art at the mill Additionally Usina da Pedra Mill and Raízen Group demonstrated interest in participating of the project All the three sent representatives to the Inception Workshop and their participation with explanation of the activities being conducted in terms of trash experiments confirmed their willingness to proceed investing to increase electricity generation with trash as far as technology and barriers can be properly addressed

Trash system successfully demonstrated in one mill by end of year 3
Trash system successfully operating in 3 mills by end of project

The project has not initiated its activities with GEF resources yet However during the assessment of the situation it has been verified that the work on the first mill with cofinancing from MCTI has been satisfactorily undertaken at Alta Mogiana Mill A visit was made in order to formalize a cooperation agreement between CTBE and the mill through the project duration Besides in order to update the trash system baseline it was started an evaluation of the state of art at the mill Additionally Usina da Pedra Mill and Raízen Group demonstrated interest in participating of the project All the three sent representatives to the Inception Workshop and their participation with explanation of the activities being conducted in terms of trash experiments confirmed their willingness to proceed investing to increase electricity generation with trash as far as technology and barriers can be properly addressed
